reviews.review:
My recommendation of NO to Portal is based on an analysis of "is this worth it". It's not a "bad" game, it just isn't an investement. It's a throw-away.

As far as the game is concerned there's nothing really fundamentally flawed about it. It's not broken in any technical sense. It does provide entertainment. It does looks nice. So on and so on.

Unfortunately, I completed it in one sitting of ~82 minutes, playing casually. So yes it's short. But short games can still be great. This however isn't one of those because, there is no replay value (short of hunting a grand total of 15 achievements). Really there's only one way to finish a level; so once the puzzle is solved, it's solved. There aren't really any easter eggs, no multiplayer, no alternate endings, nothing to make me want to come back to it.

Even among all the positive reviews for Portal, the average game time is much LESS than 10 hours.

My recommendation: find a friend who has it, play it and be done with it. Alternatively, Steam has so many sales on many other games that provide much better bang for buck in terms of value, all the time. You won't miss much having this curious but forgettable item in your library.

---EDIT--- I would like to state that at the time I wrote this, the full price was USD$20, which was the point of my review. It's a game everyone should experience, but it wasn't worth the full price considering the amount of, or lack of content that the average player would experience (which you can see from all the other reviews is only a few hours with the exception of some who managed almost 30).

The game is now 10$ which is better, but even then I would wait for a sale. It's not a reflection of the games technical quality, but rather the value of entertainment to cost when compared to other games availabe which provide much better ratio.

Either way, thanks for reading!
---/EDIT---
Somewhat difficult, lovable character. Love this game!

It features "portals" with wormhole-like properties.  It is a very clever idea, that is outstandingly executed. There are some laughs too.  Portal 2 is even more fun, but do this original one first to get the story in order. Portal is outstanding in every way.

So, first things first, super original concept, hadn't ever gotten around to playing it until now and it's a great game. I will say, if you get annoyed easily, don't play it. For one, some of the puzzles can be pretty tricky, and it'll irritate the hell out of you when you see the answer right in front of you. Second, GLaDOS's voice (except for the end), might be the most obnoxious thing I've ever heard, and if the game was less than I expected, I probably would've stopped then. Wonderful concept, slightly annoying features.

Игра Portal 2 выходила на современных платформах и является наверно самой занимательной игрой в сборнике от компании Valve – Orange Box.

Вы играете девушкой-тестером нового разработанного устройства, открывающие межпространственные порталы. Вам предстоит выполнять различные задание, которые по мере будет сообщать главный компьютер комплекса. Но после успешного прохождения всего теста новенькой штуковины, компьютер захочет убить вас (т.к. вы очень много знаете о секретной разработке). И вам уже ближе к концу игры предстоит выбраться из ловушек спятившего виртуального интеллекта.

Portal je logická FPS hra s velice originálním konceptem a poutavým příběhem, která nás na několik hodin vtáhne do laboratoří Aperture Science. Hrou vás provází umělá inteligence těchto laboratoří tzv. GLaDOS, která je unikátní svým suše černým humorem. Postupem hrou se učíte nové mechaniky a ty staré využváte vždy novým způsobem tak, že se hra nestává rutinní, což je u logické hry důležité. Hře se dá vytknout krátká herní doba, která činí něco přes 3 hodiny. Hra je zakončena závěrečnými titulky, ve kterých zazní úžasná písnička "Still Alive", nazpívaná samotnou GLaDOS. Doporučuji pro fanoušky série Half - Life, ale i všem fanouškům logických her.
8/10

포탈은 퍼즐게임의 새로운 장르를 창조해낸 혁신적인 게임이며 예술작품입니다 뭔가 복잡해 보이면서도 쉬웠던 게임이고 저에게 게임의 새로운 모습을 보여줬던 게임인거 같했습니다 이런 이유로 포탈1을 여러분께 추천드리고 싶습니다. 이 게임을 만들어주신 VALVE사 에게 감사하며 앞으로도 계속 응원합니다 그럼 감상평을 끝마겠습니다.

Portal je jednou z nejlepších logických her, kterou jsem kdy hrál. Pobaví vás jejím černým humorem, i její zajímavé úrovně, s kterýma vás bude doprovázet hlas Super-Počítačo-Robota GLaDOS. Začneme příběhem. Probutíte se v "Aperture Science Enrichment Center", kde vám hlas GLaDOS říká, co budete dělat, co tu děláte, a proč tu jste. Protože GLaDOS miluje testy, tak vám jich dá 19.

Samozřejmě by jste to nezvládli, kdyby vám GLaDOS nedala zařízení s názvem "Aperture Science Handheld Portal Device", které spousta lidí zná jako Portal Gun. Co s ním můžete dělat? Jak už název napověděl, Portál! A dokonce dva. V prvních testech máte možnost střílet pouze modrý, ale pak vám GLaDOS dá těžší testy, ve kterém budete muset používat i oranžový.

Proč ale děláte ty testy? GLaDOS vám totiž slibuje dort. Takže jakmile budete u posledního testu, tak vám slibuje, že vám ho dá. Což nakonec nebyla pravda, a chce vás zabít! Co teď dělat? Snažte se utéct z této laboratoře, a doufat, že to přežijete.

Ve hře nenajdete žádného jiného člověka, tím pádem jste tam jenom vy. Jste sám, v jedné velké laboratoři. Atmosféra je perfektní, a to nejen díky skvělému soundtracku, který se stal jeden z mých nejoblíbenějších, ale i díky tomu, že jedinou věc kterou ve hře potkáte, jsou věžičky a kostky. Pak zde najdete vašeho jediného přítele, Companion Cube.

Celková hra je krátká, což nevadí, protože vás určitě zabaví. Černý humor GLaDOS, atmosféra hry, logické úrovně, a různé bonusy typu: těžší úrovně, dohraj úroveň pod 1 minutu nebo vystřel co nejméne portálů, vám poskytnou jednu z nejlepších logických her na světě.

Prostě, a jednodušše...
Výborná logická hra, s nejlepšími hláškami v herní historii, a povedenými logickými úrovněmi.

[i] Cake is a LIE![/i]

Amazing game. Such a simple concept, placing portals to solve puzzles. An extremely iconic game and everyone should play it. The game does a good job of starting you off with simple puzzles to acquaint you with the idea of portals. Later, you get to the harder puzzles and those become more and more interesting. The game can be completed in just a few hours on a first run, but you will find yourself spending much more time on the game than that. You will want to replay it just to solve the puzzles again, or to find new ways to solve the puzzles. You will want to play the challenge versions. Count your portals shot, or race against the clock. An incredibly fun game that is now a centrepiece to video game culture. The cake may be a lie, but the praise of this game for sure is not.

I have completed this game multiple time on the Xbox 360 and now for the first time on PC, The puzzles and challenges in this game are timeless, the main story is light hearted and fun (though possibly too short). The bonus missions add a lot more of a challenge to the game which only makes it even better. 

My only small gripe is the length of the core game, however if you need another fix of Portal gameplay, just fire up Portal 2!

Overall a very fun game and one that will remain a classic for years to come.

Por ser um jogo de quebra cabeças não imaginava que iria gostar tanto de Portal, porem a medida que fui jogando fui percebendo o quao espetacular é esse jogo, a ideia de criar portais para passar as fases é muito bem usada, e faz com que se tenha que criar estrategias com eles para passar os desafios...O jogo não é tão dificil, eu enrolei em alguns momentos mas nada que fosse quase impossivel de resolver.
O jogo em si é muito bom, porem não seria isso tudo se não fosse uma vozinha no fundo durante o jogo todo, GLaDOS é simplesmente o destaque do jogo, desde o inicio até o fim, com suas frases malucas quem fazem você da risada e se irritar com suas tagareladas!

Un bien bon puzzle game qui nous fait réfléchir différement. Le principe (génial) a rendu ce jeu culte! Le fait qu'il faut à peine plus d'une heure pour finir le jeu peu faire peur à certain ( dont moi), mais si vous êtes du genre à aimé les défis il va falloir vous accrocher pour obtenir toutes les médailles d'or. C'est simple j'en suis à 17h de jeu et je suis loin d'avoir réussi tout les défis. Si vous n'êtes pas du genre défis/achievement, le pack avec Portal1+2 (ou l'orange box) vous fournira de bonne heures de jeu à prix réduit. En un mot: foncez!
The cake isn't a lie.

A game I just finished roughly in about 2 - 3 hours (the difference being all the "figuring out" time), Portal is a game certainly worth owning.

This is from a person who blindly bought Portal 2 without any prior knowledge of its earlier surprise success or without the imagination necessary to fathom how "portal mechanics" in of itself, without any other additive, be a good game.
Though I enjoyed the pacing, character dynamics, and indirect indie movie-like world building in Portal 2 more, going back to see how it all began will help explain particular jokes and flesh out many of GlaDOS's warped programming. If there's one complaint about Portal it's that, yes, it's a bit short even if for $10 but it's not like you aren't gettiing your entertainment/experience value and its chock full of special features for further insight if that's your sorta thing (it is to me!)

One complaint that might not bother others but sorta bothered me - again because I'm comparing it to 2 instead of vice versa - is that the game wastes no time piling complexity at you versus in #2 how it could often blend world building and exploration more frequently. It's a case of tight budgeting vs. free property reign but I feel it should be addressed.

All in all, Portal again cements Valve's rep at never offering inept neurally challenged games. Believe the hype or challenge it, either way, playing any entry from the series will add something you'll cherish in your life.
